qas.question: In Iran, who has the final say in all matters directly related to the Supreme Leader?
Who exercises exective powers in Iran?
The Council of Ministers is appointed and supervised by who?
How many Vice-Presidents serve under the President in Iran?
The legislature approves the 8 vice presidents and how many cabinet members?

context: <a1_0>The President<a1_0/> is responsible for the implementation of the Constitution and for the exercise of executive powers, except for matters directly related to <a0_0>the Supreme Leader<a0_0/>, who has the final say in all matters. <a2_0>The President<a2_0/> appoints and supervises the Council of Ministers, coordinates government decisions, and selects government policies to be placed before the legislature. <a3_0>Eight<a3_0/> Vice-Presidents serve under the President, as well as a cabinet of <a4_0>twenty-two<a4_0/> ministers, who must all be approved by the legislature.
